meanings.definition: Present participle of 'snaw': to cut or bite into something with the teeth
meanings.sent1: The puppy was snawing on a bone.
meanings.sent2: She was snawing on an apple.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was snawing on the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The termite was snawing through the wood like a tiny saw.
meanings.sent5: The beaver's snawing was loud and persistent.

meanings.definition: Present participle of 'snaw': to wear away or erode something gradually
meanings.sent1: The constant dripping was snawing at the rock.
meanings.sent2: The river was snawing away at the riverbank.
meanings.sent3: The wind was snawing at the sandcastle.
meanings.sent4: Time's relentless snawing eroded the ancient statue.
meanings.sent5: The waves were snawing at the cliff face.

meanings.definition: Present participle of 'snaw': to gnaw or chew on something persistently
meanings.sent1: The mouse was snawing on the cheese.
meanings.sent2: The beaver was snawing on a log.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was snawing on a toy.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar was snawing through the leaf.
meanings.sent5: The rabbit was snawing on a carrot.
